website_summaries.verdict: With a high quality stainless steel material in the construction, the heat distribution is even.
pros: Pot is available in capacities ranging from 5 to 45 gallons, so you can pick just the right capacity for your needs
Ships with a thermometer built into it, so you can easily see whether you’re maintaining a steady temperature
cons: Requires an assembly process that can be a little tricky to complete

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product. Spend your money elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Not suitable for a brewpot. I used a basic, stainless steel turkey fry pot for years to brew in, then decided to "upgrade". This is a cheap piece of crap. The fittings don't seal easily (even with a LOT of pipe tape), the pot walls are thin and flex, and the thermometer is cheaply built. Not at all what I expected. But, I got what I paid for. Stay away. I sent this junk back within an hour of unboxing it.
customer_reviews.author: RaH

customer_reviews.title: ... thermometer reaches too far inside of it and is annoying to stir around when you want to stir vigorously
customer_reviews.text: the thermometer reaches too far inside of it and is annoying to stir around when you want to stir vigorously. when brewing beer in this, the thermometer stresses/damages any mesh bags you put inside. even when done according to directions, the gaskets still begin to leak easily. it arrived bent and with dings in it. residue sticks to and is difficult to clean from the metal. but for all the complaints, the item does the bare minimum of a job.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Certainly good value for money compared to competitors. I had expected less assembly was required, and with thread tape necessary was a little unsure if I had done a good enough job (I bought a couple, and on one of them I had to redo the assembly because there was a slight leak). But if assembled perfectly, which isn't extremely difficult but a little more annoying than I thought, the product is exactly what you'd expect. Easy to use, accurate thermometer, easy to clean, quality materials, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be gentle with the brew pot and fittings
customer_reviews.text: Use the teflon thread tape provided on all threaded fittings. You really don"t need a wrench, hand tighten, being careful to only snug up fittings that have o-rings. My kettle did not leak. When done using, remove the thermometer and ball valve along with the fittings penetrating the kettle wall. This makes cleaning and storage easier and reduces the chance of damage while handling.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Use thicker thread tape and take your time
customer_reviews.text: Since the fittings are 1/2" NPT, I found it much easier to get a good seal by using a couple turns of yellow 'gas' thread tape, then finger-tightening the connections. the thermometer seal leaked a couple drops per minute, but for my brewing application, the leak quickly sealed itself off when the leaking wort boiled, leaving behind sticky malt residue. Observed boiling began when thermometer read 212 degrees at 860 ft above sea level - accurate within 1 degree.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Russell

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality but it works
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality but it works. had some issues with leaking around the thermometer and it lacks a whirlpool port. Purchased so I could do 5 gallon batches and not have to worry about boil overs.

In summary, spend and extra 50-100$ and but a purpose made brew kettle. The previous review about the extra long therm probe is very accurate. I use that for a whirlpool hole now.

customer_reviews.title: Held up well after first boil.
customer_reviews.text: A bit tricky to get the spigot and thermometer set properly. Used lots of teflon tape to get it right. Ball joint on spigot does have some lubricant on it which would definitely ruin your beer. Boil the heck out of it prior putting on kettle to get rid of the lube. Pot held up well for the boil...no scortching and easy to clean. Pot bottom seemed a bit concave. When I added the 4+ gallons and grain, pot continually rocked. I plan on hammering it down to level it off.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. DeMeo

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great kettle, great support!
customer_reviews.text: Kettle is beautiful. Had some trouble with set up but it was 100% operator error. Customer service was right there to help me out. Have not brewed with it yet, but the kettle is exactly as advertised and completely leak free upon testing
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Tyson
